metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6810 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
After a website had entered fullscreen mode, it could have used a previously opened popup to obscure the notification that indicates the browser is in fullscreen mode. Combined with spoofing the browser chrome, this could have led to confusing the user about the current origin of the page and credential theft or other attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 74.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
